properties.areaDesc: Northern Monterey Bay; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; San Francisco; Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 31 at 11:39AM PST until January 1 at 9:00AM PST by NWS San Francisco CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...A long period northwesterly swell will bring an
increased threat of sneaker waves and rip currents to area
beaches this afternoon through Wednesday morning. Swells will
increase on Wednesday and will cause very large breakers.

* WHERE...Coastline from Sonoma County southward through
Monterey County.

* WHEN...From 1 PM PST Tuesday through 9 AM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Large breaking waves will generate hazardous
conditions on area beaches. This threat will be maximized on
steeply sloped beaches. Rip currents can pull swimmers and
surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury,
wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats
near shore.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Swell heights 6 to 9 feet at 22 to 24
seconds are expected late this afternoon to tomorrow morning.
Swells will then build to 11 to 14 feet at 20 to 22 seconds
Wednesday. This will generate breaking waves of 20 to 25 feet,
favored locations may exceed 25 feet.
properties.instruction:
Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay
near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in
such conditions, stay off the rocks.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN REMAINS EFFECT FROM 9 AM WEDNESDAY TO 9 AM PST THURSDAY
